hackathon-description-text: innovAGE is a grassroots movement, being held over two weekends in a radical format that brings together innovators in aged care, technology, data and design.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: National CEO, Leading Age Services Australia (LASA)
CEO of GreenMag Group and Mineral Carbonation International (MCi)
ICT Manager, Goodwin Aged Care Services
Director Of Business Development, Opaque Multimedia
Executive Manager Business Operations, Goodwin Aged Care Services

hackathon-eligibility:
You can register as an individual ($50 for both weekends) or as a team (maximum of 4).
Team members must register separately and indicate you are a part of a team.
Don't worry if you're flying solo – we'll help you to team up on the first day of innovAGE. You can also start discussions with fellow participants in the Discussion tab here on ChallengePost.
hackathon-requirements:
Solutions can be from any discipline and we have themed the areas of activity:
 
Older Australians' and their carers experience daily problems in these areas.
 
When
You must have permission to use all content in your video, including footage, music, and images.  Additional support materials may be uploaded as part of your submission - e.g. screen shots, pdf, word, apk, etc.


 
Below showcases some of the judges for the Final Weekend (3 May).  A number of investors will also be spectators for the live pitches.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $2,500 CASH prize shared with team members, $3,000 Virtual Incubation Package (Thanks to Lighthouse Business Innovation Centre), $250 value Kinect v2 Sensor - one per team member, max 4 (Thanks to Opaque Multimedia), $130 ibeacons Developer Kit (Thanks to estimate), Attendance and Display of Project at LASA National Congress in Melbourne, October 2015 (valued at $3,800)
$1,500 CASH prize shared with team members
$1,000 CASH prize shared with team members
* Kinect v2 Sensor ($250 per team member (max 4))
Runner-up prize - * Kinect v2 Sensor ($250 per team member (max 4))
2 x estimote Beacons Developer Kit ($130 each) comes  with 6 estimote Beacons. Special thanks to estimote
2 x estimote Beacons Developer Kit ($130 each) comes with 6 estimote Beacons. Special thanks to estimote

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Is the problem issues clearly defined and is the solution relevant?
Is it intuitive? Easy to understand and use? Can it be used by the intended market?
If  a tech based product has it been executed in a novel and/or interesting way? Eg. working web application, App, VR, static HTML pages, documented code
Does it work as is, or does it require additional resources (code or data?)
Does the solution fulfil the spirit of helping Older Australians to live well? To what extend have you solved a real problem?

hackathon-description-header: Develop the next big thing in aged care!
